name: PushSalesOrder
description:
Creates an order with all specified data, places it, and raises all follow-up events.

Whenever the order already exists with the same BackendSystemID/BackendID combination, nothing will be modified.
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Api` with functionality `PushSalesOrder:None`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

  },

    "Amount": 123.456,

    },

C.name: OriginalCreationDate
C.description: Original date when this order was created

C.name: OriginalInvoiceDate
C.description: Original date when this order was invoiced

C.name: OriginalInvoiceNumber
C.description:
Original invoicenumber of this order

This string must be between 0 (incl) and 50 (incl) characters long.

D.name: CountryID
D.description:
ISO 3166-1

This is the ID of a `Country`

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 2 (incl) characters long.

G.name: DateTimeValue
G.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

G.name: NumberValue
G.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

G.name: StringValue
G.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

F.name: CustomFieldID
F.description:
Identifier for the custom field

This is the ID of a `CustomField`

F.name: DateTimeValue
F.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

F.name: NumberValue
F.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

F.name: StringValue
F.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

E.name: BackendID
E.description: Only applicable when a new company is created

E.name: ID
E.description:
If provided and valid, the existing company data will be updated

This is the ID of a `Company`

E.name: Name
E.description: If not provided on create, the creation of a new company will be skipped

E.name: SingleUse
E.description: Only applicable when a new company is created

E.name: UserID
E.description:
Only applicable when a new company is created

This is the ID of a `User`

I.name: AccountType
I.description:
Is this a Standard/Basic/Incognito account?
Possible values:

* `0` - Standard
* `1` - Basic
* `2` - Incognito

I.name: Company
I.deprecation_notice:
**Deprecated since 786:** Company is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.818: Use PushSalesOrder.Company instead.

**Will be removed in 802**
I.description:
**Deprecated since 786:** Company is deprecated and will be removed in 2.0.818: Use PushSalesOrder.Company instead.

**Will be removed in 802**

I.name: CountryID
I.description:
ISO 3166-1

This is the ID of a `Country`

This string must be between 2 (incl) and 2 (incl) characters long.

I.name: Gender
I.description: Possible values are: M, F, O

I.name: LanguageID
I.description:
ISO 639-1

This is the ID of a `Language`

K.name: Amount
K.description: Amount of the discount, typically with a negative value

K.name: BackendID
K.description: Reference to the discount of the 3rd party

R.name: ShipmentBackendID
R.description: Identifier of the shipment, must exist in the Order.Shipments

R.name: ShipmentDate
R.description: Date when this shipment line was shipped, will fall-back to the Shipment.ShipmentDate

M.name: Amount
M.description: Price of a single unit, before discounts, based on the SoldFromOrganizationUnit settings this should be in or ex tax. See service documentation.

M.name: BackendID
M.description: ID of the order line from the 3rd party

M.name: CustomID
M.description: Article number of the product from the 3rd party

M.name: GiftcardData
M.description: Used for passing in the data for a digital giftcard.

M.name: GiftcardMedia
M.description: Used for passing in the media information for a digital giftcard.

M.name: IsFinalSale
M.description: Marks the line as a final sale line, making it non returnable.

M.name: OriginalAmount
M.description: Original price of a single unit, before discounts, based on the SoldFromOrganizationUnit settings this should be in or ex tax. See service documentation.

M.name: PaymentLineIdentifier
M.description: Used for passing the identifier used to identify this line at the payment provider. This is required for payments that need capture on line level like Klarna.

M.name: PreferredFulfillmentOrganizationUnitBackendID
M.description:
Allows you to specify a preferred organization for doing the physical fulfillment of the OrderLine.
Depending on your order orchestration configuration this can be a hard filter or merely a preference.

M.name: ProductID
M.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

M.name: SerialNumber
M.description: Used for passing in the serial number of, for example, a gift card. This is used to support refunding and other operations on the gift card.

M.name: TaxAmount
M.description: When known the exact TaxAmount can be specified. Used when tax calculations are done by an external party like Avatax.

M.name: TaxExemptionCode
M.description: A code identifying the tax exemption.

M.name: TaxExemptionReason
M.description: A longer description with the justification for the tax exemption.

M.name: TaxRate
M.description: When no tax rate is provided, the taxrate will be based on what is known in Eva. When no rate can be determined, an error will be thrown.

M.name: TaxRateCategory
M.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - High
* `1` - Low
* `2` - Zero
* `3` - Exempt
* `4` - Intermediate
* `5` - Dynamic

L.name: Amount
L.description: Price of a single unit, before discounts, based on the SoldFromOrganizationUnit settings this should be in or ex tax. See service documentation.

L.name: BackendID
L.description: ID of the order line from the 3rd party

L.name: ChildLines
L.description: Child lines for this line

L.name: CustomFields
L.description: Optional additional custom fields

L.name: CustomID
L.description: Article number of the product from the 3rd party

L.name: FulfillmentMethod
L.description:
Possible values:

* `1` - Delivery
* `2` - Pickup
* `3` - CarryOut

L.name: GiftcardData
L.description: Used for passing in the data for a digital giftcard.

L.name: GiftcardMedia
L.description: Used for passing in the media information for a digital giftcard.

L.name: GroupID
L.description: Optional grouping identifier to keep lines 'together'.

L.name: IsFinalSale
L.description: Marks the line as a final sale line, making it non returnable.

L.name: OriginalAmount
L.description: Original price of a single unit, before discounts, based on the SoldFromOrganizationUnit settings this should be in or ex tax. See service documentation.

L.name: PaymentLineIdentifier
L.description: Used for passing the identifier used to identify this line at the payment provider. This is required for payments that need capture on line level like Klarna.

L.name: PreferredFulfillmentOrganizationUnitBackendID
L.description:
Allows you to specify a preferred organization for doing the physical fulfillment of the OrderLine.
Depending on your order orchestration configuration this can be a hard filter or merely a preference.

L.name: ProductID
L.description: This is the ID of a `Product`

L.name: ProductRequirements
L.description: Product requirements

L.name: SerialNumber
L.description: Used for passing in the serial number of, for example, a gift card. This is used to support refunding and other operations on the gift card.

L.name: TaxAmount
L.description: When known the exact TaxAmount can be specified. Used when tax calculations are done by an external party like Avatax.

L.name: TaxExemptionCode
L.description: A code identifying the tax exemption.

L.name: TaxExemptionReason
L.description: A longer description with the justification for the tax exemption.

L.name: TaxRate
L.description: When no tax rate is provided, the taxrate will be based on what is known in Eva. When no rate can be determined, an error will be thrown.

L.name: TaxRateCategory
L.description:
Possible values:

* `0` - High
* `1` - Low
* `2` - Zero
* `3` - Exempt
* `4` - Intermediate
* `5` - Dynamic

S.name: AllowPartialFulfillment
S.description: Allow the order to be fulfilled in multiple shipments

S.name: CheckOpenAmountIsZero
S.description: When true, this service call return with an error when the order does not end up with an open amount of exactly 0

S.name: DoNotInvoice
S.description: Never generate an invoice for this order. The order will be completed when it's Paid+Shipped

T.name: Amount
T.description: Amount of the payment that was actually paid

T.name: AutoConfirm
T.description:
Whether to automatically confirm the payment or adhere to the payment type configuration.
The default value is set to true.

T.name: BackendID
T.description: Identifier of the payment by the 3rd party (e.g. the one from the payment service provider (PSP))

T.name: CaptureMoment
T.description:
If this is set to not None, the Payment will not be considered captured, but only Authorized. This means the capture will be done based on this value.
If it's not set, the CaptureMoment will be determined based on the PaymentType.
Possible values:

* `0` - None
* `1` - Manual
* `2` - Ship
* `3` - Confirmation

T.name: CapturedAmount
T.description:
Part (or all) of the amount that has already been captured for this payment.
This amount should always be in the base currency of the order.

T.name: Data
T.description: Data that can be used to store anything that may be required later to verify the payment for example

T.name: ForeignAmount
T.description:
This property is optional but becomes mandatory when a payment is made in a currency different from the order base currency.
It indicates the specific amount paid in the foreign currency.

T.name: ForeignCurrencyID
T.description:
This property is optional but becomes mandatory when a payment is made in a currency different from the order base currency.
It indicates the currency used for the payment.

V.name: BackendID
V.description: Identifier of the shipment; should also be filled on Line.Shipments.ShipmentBackendID

V.name: ShipmentDate
V.description: Date when this shipment was shipped

W.name: Amount
W.description: ShippingCosts, before discounts, based on the SoldFromOrganizationUnit settings this should be in or ex tax. See service documentation.

W.name: Method
W.description: Method that is used to ship the order (e.g. UPS, DHL, etc.)

W.name: PaymentLineIdentifier
W.description: Used for passing the identifier used to identify the shipping costs at the payment provider. This is required for payments that need capture on line level like Klarna.

W.name: TaxAmount
W.description: When known the exact TaxAmount can be specified. Used when tax calculations are done by an external party like Avatax.

W.name: TaxRate
W.description: Tax rate of the shipping method, when `Amount` / `UnitPriceInTax` is set and it's not provided, the taxrate will be based on what is known in Eva. When no rate can be determined, an error will be thrown.

B.name: BackendID
B.description: A unique identifier for the order, within the context of given `BackendSystemID`

B.name: BackendSystemID
B.description: A code, free of choice for the calling 3rd party application creating the order

B.name: CurrencyID
B.description: ISO code of the currency of the order

B.name: DisableEventExports
B.description: Enabling this will try to suppress as many eventexports as possible that might result from this call.

B.name: FulfillmentMethod
B.description:
How this order is fulfilled, this can be overridden on line level. Default to Delivery or Pickup (when a PickupOrganizationUnit is defined)
Possible values:

* `1` - Delivery
* `2` - Pickup
* `3` - CarryOut

B.name: LockOrder
B.description: Lock Order and block any future changes on it.

B.name: PickupOrganizationUnitBackendID
B.description: Identifier for the shop where the order will be picked up, if any (`OrganizationUnit.BackendID`

B.name: ReturnToSupplierReason
B.description: The reason for this ReturnToSupplier order, used in combination with Properties.ReturnToSupplier. Required for ReturnToSupplier orders

B.name: ShipToOrganizationUnitBackendID
B.description: Identifier for the shop where the order will be shipped to, if any (`OrganizationUnit.BackendID`

B.name: SoldFromOrganizationUnitBackendID
B.description: Identifier for the (web)shop that made the sale (`OrganizationUnit.BackendID`)

Y.name: Code
Y.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

Y.name: Message
Y.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

Y.name: RequestID
Y.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

Y.name: Type
Y.description: A short description of the error type.

Z.name: ExternalIDs
Z.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

Z.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
Z.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

Z.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
Z.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

X.name: CompanyID
X.description: This is the ID of a `Company`

X.name: CustomerID
X.description: This is the ID of a `User`

X.name: ID
X.description: This is the ID of a `Order`
